Instructors

Business

Adam Prokop

Adam Prokop

MBA, MSc, MFin, CPA, CMA, CAIA

Adam works as a Senior Risk Analyst and Consultant in the real estate industry, as well as a Corporate Trainer specializing in technical skills development. He has worked in various sectors including finance, energy, real estate, and government. Adam has taught and developed courses in accounting, finance, general business, mathematics, supply chain, and operations for several years across Canada.

Adam has a Master of Business Administration (MBA) from McMaster University, a Master in Finance (MFin) from Queen’s University, a Post-Graduate Diploma (PGD) in Organizational Psychology from the University of London, and a Master of Science (MSc) in Supply Chain Management from Wilfrid Laurier University. He also holds professional designations as a Chartered Professional Accountant (CPA, CMA) and Chartered Alternative Investment Analyst (CAIA).

Addie Batson

Addie Batson

Addie Batson is an accomplished Customer Success Manager and Consultant with a rich history of driving growth and enhancing customer experiences. With an Honors BA in Communications and Business from York University, Adnahn’s academic foundation laid the groundwork for a stellar career.

Former student leadership roles as the President of Winters College Council and Student Director at the York Federation of Students underscore Addie’s knack for effective collaboration and community leadership.

With a strong track record spanning over 6 years, Adnahn has lent expertise to high-profile organizations including Uber, Clearco, Shopify, Bird, and the DMZ. Addie’s strategic approach centers on cultivating robust customer success journeys, facilitating lasting growth, and fostering unwavering customer loyalty.

Addie looks forward to channeling insights and experience to advance institutional initiatives at his Alma Mata.

Airan Friedman

Airan Friedman

CFA, MBA, FRM

Airan is a Senior Risk Management, Treasury, and Capital Markets professional with 27 years experience, including 15+ years of progressive responsibility in associated risks (Liquidity, Market and Credit). Recognizing the importance of Accounting early on, he mastered Accounting in his undergrad including the recipient of Deloitte and Touche scholarships which included an internship. Airan was also a 2011 & 2012 Judge for Corporate Reporting Awards sponsored by the CICA. He started off his career in Market Risk and has spent the past 10 years focused on Credit and Liquidity Risk, primarily at the largest Canadian Banks. Airan has earned the Chartered Financial Analyst and Financial Risk Manager designations coupled with his MBA from Schulich School of Business which he earned in 2000. Outside of work, Airan enjoys family time with his wife and two young (and highly active) daughters. He enjoys photography as a hobby, but rates himself a novice at best.

Alex Naumov

Alex Naumov

Alex Naumov is an accomplished professional with a strong background in the technology industry, specifically in the field of Software as a Service (SaaS). Passionate about customer success, Alex has been making significant contributions in this area for the past 7 years.

Currently serving as the Senior Director of Customer Success at Vidyard, Alex has played a pivotal role in fostering long-term partnerships through developing tailored approaches to enhance customer experiences and drive business value.

His dedication to customer success and keen ability to navigate the complexities of the industry have allowed him to take on leadership roles in the larger CS community. A highlight of this effort includes his role as a mentor within the Catalyst coaching program.

In his personal life, Alex’s days are filled as a father to 3 energetic boys ages 7, 7, and 9 (that’s right, twins!). They keep him busy with a variety of sports, a love of Lego & Harry Potter, and lots of hijinks.

 

Alfonsina Chang

Alfonsina Chang

Alfonsina is a Professor teaching human resources subjects in post-secondary education since 2002. Alfonsina has held various positions in the field of human resources in large, private and public organizations. Areas of expertise are in organizational learning, performance and change management, talent acquisition, and organizational effectiveness.

Alfonsina graduated from York University with a major in Psychology and later completed her graduate certificate in Human Resources Management at Seneca College. She went on to successfully pursue her M. Ed in Adult Education at Brock University. With her strong passion for learning, Alfonsina’s long range goal is to complete her PhD in Organizational Psychology.

Amal Shabana

Amal Shabana

MBA, CPA, CMA

Amal is a highly dedicated accounting professional with solid background in both government and not-for-profit sectors; experienced in financial accounting, financial reporting, budgeting & forecasting, managerial and cost accounting, performance management, performance measurement (KPI), and internal auditing. Amal has demonstrated leadership in collaborating with examination and evaluation of organizational processes to ensure compliance with accounting policies and regulatory requirements, to report findings and risk areas, and to recommend possible improvements and corrections. Some of her roles include business analyst, senior accountant and others.

Amal completed her business accounting diploma, in 2009, from Mohawk College, with Dean’s Honour List. Also, she earned her Chartered Professional Accountant (CPA, CMA) designation, in 2012, from CPA Ontario, followed by a Master of Business Administration, specializing in Strategic Management in 2021, from Wilfrid Laurier University.

Amal enjoys giving back to the business community, in helping CPA students work towards their designation, by volunteering as a board panel member for the final assessment of the CPA Professional Education Program Capstone 1 Oral Board Report, from 2015-2019. Also, she volunteered as a provincial judge at DECA Ontario regional competitions in 2016 and 2019.

Amanpreet Chhina

Amanpreet Chhina

BA, MBA, PhD (International Marketing)

Dr. Amanpreet Chhina brings over 20 years of experience in both teaching and researching marketing at the university level. In addition to teaching with the School of Continuing Studies at York University, Amanpreet is a Professor of International Marketing in the Faculty of Business at Humber College in Toronto. Amanpreet has taught a wide range of courses, including Introduction to Marketing, Consumer Behaviour, Advertising and Sales, Retail Marketing, International Marketing and Customer Service.

Amanpreet’s teaching career spans over Asia and North America and she brings with her a wealth of global experience. Amanpreet is actively involved in applied research in collaboration with companies and organizations on topics that include consumer behavior in online marketing, inclusive marketing for business owner policy, sustainable marketing and emerging marketing technology.

In addition to teaching and researching, Amanpreet founded GreyCells Global Consultancy Inc., which provides international business advice to small and medium enterprises. Amanpreet earned a Doctorate of Philosophy (PhD) in International Marketing, along with a Masters in Business Economics and Bachelor of Arts degree with Economics Honours.

Ana Caracaleanu

Ana Caracaleanu

HBA, MBA (Global)

Ana is a seasoned marketing leader with over 14 years of experience working in the real estate, fashion and tech industries. As an entrepreneur, Ana launched the first product-based crowdfunding platform and a learning hub for emerging brands. Her passion is working with tech startups and she is currently an Advisor with Loyal.vc, where she helps startups with their marketing and communication strategies.

Over the last 8 years, Ana has been teaching marketing courses at post-secondary institutions across the Greater Toronto Area. She holds an Honors Bachelor of Arts degree from the University of Toronto, and a Masters in Business Administration from Toronto Metropolitan University. She is advancing her education with a Certificate in Leaders of Learning from Harvard University.

Andrew Hamilton

Andrew Hamilton

Bachelors in Economics, MBA in Finance & International Business, Certified Management Consultant

Andrew is a Strategy and Organizational Consultant with successful experience building and growing consulting businesses. He has led over 65 consulting engagements in ten countries over 22 years focused on transformation, performance improvement and better outcomes in both the public and health sectors.

Andrew empowers his clients through a combination of technical expertise, collegiality, and deep understanding of their work, the context and the challenges they face. He leads his teams through stewardship, building on their strengths and inspiring them to share his passion for positive results and impact.

Highlights of Andrew’s professional experience include:

  • driving Nous Group Canada’s growth from start-up to a 40+ FTE management consulting practice;
  • serving as founding Director of KPMG’s Centre for Universal Health Coverage (UHC) where he advised international clients on health system transformation;
  • establishing and growing a management consulting practice in the Caribbean. Key project was leading a large multi-national team that supported the design and implementation of National Health Insurance in The Bahamas;
  • leading dozens of consulting projects in Canada, the Middle East, Asia, Latin America and the Caribbean;
  • working with various First Nations Organizations;
  • mentoring and learning from many brilliant, creative, and driven colleagues.

Andrew recently launched Hamilton and Associates, his own independent consulting practice. His current research is focused on the application of Machine Learning and Generative AI to drive organizational transformation.  Andrew has a Bachelors in Economics and MBA in Finance & International Business. He is a Certified Management Consultant with the Institute for Certified Management Consultants of Ontario.

 

Andrew Temes

Andrew Temes

Andrew Temes brings over 25 years in marketing and sales experience to his students; having worked for companies such as Colgate-Palmolive, Mars, Novartis/GSK, and Enercare Home & Commercial Services. He has been featured in marketing publications, as a speaker at industry conferences, guest lecturer at the Schulich School of Business, and as an adjunct Professor of interactive marketing and strategy at York University, Seneca College and the University of Toronto for over 15 years. Andrew holds a Bachelor of Arts degree from Western University and a Master of Business Administration degree with a major in Marketing, from Schulich School of Business.

Andy Li

Andy Li

CPA, CA, MFin

Andy has over 12 years of experience in progressively responsible roles within the financial service industry, primarily focusing on financial reporting, performance measurement and assurance & auditing. He is currently a Senior Audit Manager at Royal Bank of Canada where he leads all aspects of audit engagement including planning, executing, and reporting. In addition, he is a facilitator in the CPA Ontario’s Professional Education Program (PEP). Andy has strong interest in education, in particular mentoring and coaching accounting students. Andy holds both Bachelor of Commerce and Master of Finance from the University of Toronto, and a Chartered Professional Accountant designation.

Andy Tse

Andy Tse

MTax, CPA, CA

Andy Tse, MTax, CPA, CA, is an assurance and taxation professional with over 14 years of experience. He began his accounting career in assurance and then took a role in financial reporting. Later, he developed an interest in taxation and joined a global accounting firm where he worked on tax audits, advisory, and compliance engagements for some of the largest companies in Canada. Currently, Andy is working in the Public Service.

Andy believes that one of the most important aspects of accounting education is instilling in students the ability to integrate technical knowledge with practical applications. Without practical applications, technical knowledge is interesting but of limited value to practicing accountants; without technical knowledge, the ability to practice accounting is severely limited by the inability to analyze known facts and determine the correct accounting treatment. This integration between theory and practice can be difficult for many students, and enabling them to make this link is his primary goal as an instructor.

Andy holds a Bachelor of Commerce degree from the University of British Columbia and a Master of Taxation degree from the University of Waterloo.

Anna Yu

Anna Yu

President of Yu Consulting Group & Senior Advisor, Finance and Business Operations with Wentworth Strategy Group

Anna Yu is the President of Yu Consulting Group and a Senior Advisor, Finance and Business Operations with Wentworth Strategy Group. Anna provides management consulting and advisory services to business leaders and companies at all stages of growth with insight on strategic planning, financial strategy, operations, risk management, operational excellence, and people optimization strategies.

As a trusted transformational leader, Anna guides companies and business leaders through growth and change by aligning people, processes, and systems to common goals. Her diverse career at Xerox Canada, Dell Financial Services, The CIT Group, and The Bank of Nova Scotia  included a broad spectrum of leadership of teams and projects.

Anna serves as a mentor to start-up companies with Futurpreneur and is an instructor at Seneca College with focus on organizational behaviour and leadership. She holds a Bachelor of Arts Honours degree majoring in Economics from the University of Toronto and is Six Sigma Green Belt certified. She is actively engaged in giving back to our communities, including helping professional newcomers to Canada navigate their careers in the Canadian market.

Anna-Marie Christian

Anna-Marie Christian

Director, Emerging Issues and Strategic Partnerships at CPA Canada

Anna-Marie Christian FCPA, FCMA is Director of Emerging Issues and Strategic Partnerships at Chartered Professional Accountants (CPA) of Canada.  Anna-Marie served on key committees spearheading the unification of the Canadian accounting profession, including the development of the CPA Professional Education Program (PEP).  She has a rich and varied background in both industry and in accounting education.  She has held management positions in property management, construction, manufacturing, consumer packaged goods and not-for-profit organizations, and was involved for over 15 years in delivering the Certified Management Accountant (CMA) Strategic Leadership Program.   She has also developed and delivered workshops on Strategy, Communication and Not For Profit Accounting.

Anna-Marie has a Bachelor of Arts (Honours – Sociology) from the University of Toronto and is a member of Chartered Professional Accountants of Ontario (CPA Ontario).   She received the prestigious “Fellow” Chartered Professional Accountant (FCPA), in 2014 in recognition for her dedication and passion to the accounting profession.

Cheryl Lee

Cheryl Lee

B.Sc., PMP, PMI-PBA, CBAP

Cheryl is the CEO of Knowledge Adapters, a Toronto-based consulting firm that offers business analysis and project management consulting and training services in the areas of business analysis, project management and change management. Clients include public and private sector organizations across all industries, including financial services, high tech, telecommunications, transportation, construction, entertainment, and all levels of government.

Cheryl is co-author of “Effective PM and BA Role Collaboration” (2015), J. Ross Publishing, and one of four global authors of The PMI Guide to Business Analysis (2017), published by the Project Management Institute (PMI). She has spoken at conferences, chapter meetings, colleges, and at universities to audiences across the globe.

Cheryl founded the PMI Toronto Chapter Business Analysis Community; the first Business Analysis Community within a PMI Chapter, and has served as a Director at Large for the International Institute of Business Analysis (IIBA) Toronto.

Cheryl is a certified Professional in Business Analysis (PMI-PBA), Project Management Professional (PMP) and Certified Business Analysis Professional (CBAP).

Doina Nugent

Doina Nugent

MA, HDipEd, Cert. Coach (NCCP) TESL(C)

Doina Nugent is a passionate and student-focused educator and coach, with over 20 years of experience developing, coordinating, and instructing Academic and Professional Communications Programs in English, German, and French at York University, in Vancouver, Victoria, Germany, the UK, and Ireland.

Her continued focus is on creating engaging, inclusive learning environments to foster communication confidence, and on helping international students and Internationally Educated Professionals adapt to the North American academic, professional, and cultural environment.

At York University, Doina has taught a variety of courses, including Research Report Writing, Critical Thinking, Public Speaking, Teamwork, Case Study Methodologies and Analysis, and Intercultural Communication. In Europe, Doina developed and delivered in-house corporate English language training programs (Business Communication) and worked as and trained Translator/Simultaneous Interpreters. Doina also worked for many years as Assistant Editor in online publishing, and as official examiner in English, German, and French for both national and international examination boards (IELTS, iCELBAN, GCSE and Advanced (A) Levels (UK), and An Roinn Oideachais, Ireland).

Doina holds an Honors B.A. in English, German and French, and a Master’s degree, both from the National University of Ireland. Her teaching specializations (Higher Diploma in Education; Teaching licenses in Ireland, UK, and Germany) include Modern Language Teaching and Assessment Methodologies, Experiential Learning, Content Learning in Language (CLIL), and Personal and Social Development.

Doina has also had a lengthy and successful career in elite ultradistance running, triathlon and high-altitude climbing, winning 5 Intercontinental and 3 World Championships.

Dr. Mohammad Nozari

Dr. Mohammad Nozari

BSc, MBA, PhD

Dr. Mohammad Nozari is a scholar-practitioner with more than 25 years of industry experience in automation, telecommunications, finance, and banking sectors and has led multi-national projects across Asia, Europe, and North America. he has taught in various universities with a focus on combination of technology, business, and management through business communications, project execution, leadership, as well as courses in software engineering.

Mohammad is an expert in delivery of complex technology products and implementing corporate strategies. He has a strong passion for education as the essential tool for making positive social change. He continuously combines his experience with teaching courses, leading to delivery of real-life up-to-date experience to his students. This has proven to be a successful approach in preparing students for their future endeavors through real life case studies.

Mohammad has a doctorate (Ph.D.) in Management, a Master’s of philosophy, a Master’s of Business Administration, and a Bachelor’s degree in Software Engineering. He continues to research in Biomimicking, an interdisciplinary field he established in his doctoral study that combines swarm intelligence with management of human resources. Mohammad’s research interests also include strategy implementation, cultural intelligence (CQ), and history. His book titled “Leadership through Battles” presents a unique view of combining history with constructs of leadership and strategy.

Tina Gardiner

Tina Gardiner

Manager, Risk Management Services, The Regional Municipality of York

Tina Gardiner is the Manager, Risk Management Services for The Regional Municipality of York, one of Canada’s fastest growing municipalities, and has accumulated over 30 years experience in risk and insurance with various corporations. During her career with York Region Tina has successfully built the Risk Management Services (RMS) unit, from the ground up, incorporating an enterprise risk management approach. Today this unit of claims and risk management professionals has a respected advisory role within the Region.

Continuing education is important to Tina having been a lifelong learner herself. After graduating with her Biology degree (BSc) from Wilfrid Laurier University she went on to complete her Chartered Insurance Professional designation (CIP) from the Insurance Institute of Canada, Canadian Risk Management designation (CRM) from University of Toronto, a Masters Certificate in Municipal Leadership from the Schulich School of Business at York University, Excellence Canada Certificate in Process Improvement Management and York Region’s own Executive Leadership Program. Tina has been an instructing insurance and risk management courses in a formal and non-formal setting since 2005.

Currently serving in her second year as a Director on the Risk and Insurance Management (RIMS) Board, Tina has been an active participant in RIMS at the Chapter level thorough ORIMS, serving several terms as President, and nationally through the RIMS Canada Council serving as Chair. Tina was humbled and honoured to receive the industry’s 2010 Don Stuart Award for Excellence in Risk Management. Tina is also an active member in the Society of Professional Insurance Administrators of Ontario (SPIAO).

Tina likes bringing people together through networking, shared experiences and as a thought leader. She is the co-founder and co- chair of two municipal risk management committees in Ontario; and has served as Chair of a Canadian on-line municipal risk management forum. Risk Management is a passion for Tina, and she loves to talk about anything risk and insurance related….. especially with rising risk and insurance professionals.

Annie Lee

Annie Lee

Lead Research Scientist, Vertical Scope

Dr. Annie Lee holds a PhD from the University of Waterloo at the Centre of Pattern Analysis and Machine Intelligence with over 12 years of experience in data mining and machine learning. Dr. Lee’s passion in finding patterns in society and in nature in the big data era has lead to dozens of publications in computational advertising, sentiment analysis, and sequence analysis, including a highly-read review paper on big data. Most notably, Dr. Lee developed interpretable unsupervised algorithms, which uncovered patterns utilizing clustering and partitioning of raw data and a priori knowledge.

Currently, Dr. Lee is the Lead Research Scientist for the Data Science team at Vertical Scope, where she drives the efforts for the in-house academic research, algorithmic implementations, and evaluations. During her tenure, Dr. Lee propelled projects on identifying product names, sentiments analysis towards product features, and topic modelling in order to generate key business insights for reporting brand and site health.

Dr. Lee is currently serving as the funding chair for Broadening Participation in Data Mining and was a co-chair of Women in Machine Learning, co-hosted with the 2010 Annual Conference on Neural Information Processing Systems in Vancouver. Dr. Lee was an NSERC and OGS scholar.

Peter Kosmala

Peter Kosmala

CIPP/US, Founder and Principal – PRIVĀT, LLC

Peter is a recognized thought leader in information privacy with 20 years of international experience as a former marketer, technologist, lobbyist and association leader and as a current consultant, educator and keynote speaker.

Peter helped grow the International Association of Privacy Professionals (IAPP) from a professional community to the world’s largest privacy association as its first Assistant Director and then as Vice President. He led the creation of the first professional certification in privacy, the IAPP’s Certified Information Privacy Professional (CIPP) in 2004 and launched the CIPP-Canada (CIPP/C) in 2006. Today, over 30,000 professionals globally hold one or more of the CIPP credentials which certify knowledge in privacy laws, standards and practices.

Peter helped to establish the Canadian office of the IAPP and the Canada Privacy Symposium, the flagship annual event held in Toronto since 2006. He has worked closely with practitioners, policy makers and regulators from around the world on privacy matters. Peter’s roots are in digital media at WIRED magazine and Hotwired, one of the very first Web publishing sites. He also served as the first managing director of the Digital Advertising Alliance (DAA) and led the expansion of the “Your Ad Choices” consumer privacy preference program.

Peter has served in leadership roles at technology companies CMGI and dataxu (now Roku), trade associations the 4A’s, DAA and the NAI and ad agencies Wells Rich Greene BDDP and MVBMS Partners/EURO RSCG. He has represented industry in policy working groups and technical standards bodies such as the Trustworthy Accountability Group (TAG) and the World Wide Web Consortium (W3C). Presently, Peter advises clients on the digital media marketplace and the evolving regulatory environment for information privacy.

He has worked for Fortune 500 companies including Procter & Gamble, Amgen, Bristol Myers Squibb, Eli Lilly, Syneos, PPD, ICON, and Parexel. His experience includes operational oversight of multi-therapeutic, global Phase I-IV drug/biologic trials, device studies, and functional outcome projects. He has managed multi-compound client portfolios and programs for key accounts including a large Phase III global study with 3000+ patients from 180 sites across 26 countries where he oversaw global clinical operations and program management for Canada, USA, and Latin America.

In his current role as Director of Clinical Operations for Parexel Biotech, Inc., Amin focuses on end-to-end program management of large global Phase II/III oncology and rare disease studies. He works with global cross-functional teams to craft program strategy, mission, and vision, manage trial and department budgets and P&L functions, develop clinical and business decision support systems, and provide consulting services to clients.

Amin is also a licensed compounding pharmacist and provides direct patient care services in community pharmacy. Amin received his HBSc. in Cell & Molecular Biology, and a professional degree in Pharmacy (BPharm) from the University of Toronto, an MBA in Corporate Finance and Entrepreneurship from Queen’s University, and a Certificate in Precision Oncology and Cancer Genomics from the Harvard School of Medicine.

Dan Ashbourne

Dan Ashbourne

PHD, C. PSYCH., Acc.FM.

Dr. Dan Ashbourne is a Clinical Psychologist, registered in Ontario by the College of Psychologists and an Accredited Family Mediator with the Ontario Association for Family Mediation. Dr. Ashbourne began working at the London Family Court Clinic in 1999 after having run a Children’s Mental Health Centre in Newfoundland, and later working in Thunder Bay across many diverse communities. He became the Executive Director at the London Family Court Clinic (LFCC) in 2011 until retiring from that role in January 2022.  LFCC provides mental health services to children and families involved with legal/clinical systems. Over many years at LFCC, Dr. Ashbourne built relationships with various Indigenous colleagues and communities, including supporting the collaboration with Oneida Settlement through the Lona’tshistanet project for children, youth, and families.  As Executive Director Emeritus of LFCC, Dr. Ashbourne continues to provide assessments and consultations to the courts for Youth in Conflict with the Law, Child Welfare and/or Parenting Plan Evaluations, as well as provide clinical and consulting support to a new LFCC division, Navigating Onward, or NavOn. He also provides consultation to the ADR-LINK referral service, the Child Witness Program, the London-Middlesex Child and Youth Advocacy Centre (CYAC), and for FASD assessment consultations.

Dr. Ashbourne has been a long-standing member of the Association of Family & Conciliation Courts (AFCC) and has sat on the Board of Directors of the Ontario Chapter. He is on the executive committee of a joint project funded by MCCSS between the Centre for Research and Education on Violence Against Women and Children (CREVAWC) and the LFCC, which is reviewing the Ontario Death Review Committee Recommendations provided following the deaths of adults and/or children. Currently, Dr. Ashbourne oversees various grants and projects at LFCC, while providing training to legal and mental health professionals on topics including trauma informed care, self-care for professionals, family relations, domestic violence, interviewing children, reporting on the Voice of the Child, and Child Inclusive Mediation.

Andrea Menard

Andrea Menard, she/they/ᐃᐧᔭᐋᐧᐤ wiyawâw is Métis from the abolished Red River Settlement on Treaty 1. Andrea is Co-Chair and Co-Founder of the Indigenous Lawyers’ Forum, which is a networking group for Indigenous lawyers, legal academics and law students. Andrea was named the Top 25 Most Influential Lawyer for Canadian Lawyer Magazine, 2022.

Kavita Bhagat

B.A., LL.B., ACC.FM

Kavita practices exclusively in the area of family law as pertains to mediating, negotiating, arbitrating and litigating residential arrangements, child and spousal support, property division and the preparation of domestic contracts. She is a Certified Specialist in Family Law, accredited Family Mediator, Arbitrator, Parenting Coordinator and former Panel Lawyer for the Office of the Children’s Lawyer. Kavita has worked closely with victims of abuse, facilitated by her fluency in five languages.

Kavita is a Coach and Advisor for the Law Society of Ontario and Legal Aid Ontario, a Board Member for the Caledon Parent-Child Centre, and Treasurer of Peel Mediation-Arbitration. She is a former Board Member of FDRIO and past-President of the Peel Chapter of the OAFM. Kavita is a regular presenter for the Ontario Justice Education Network, Mandatory Information Program, Catholic Cross-Cultural Services, Canadian Council of Muslim Women and multiple Continuing Professional Development programs.

Marc Bhalla

Marc Bhalla

LL.M. (DR), C.Med, C.Arb

Marc (he/him) [biracial] is a mediator, arbitrator and adjudicator. Designated a Chartered Mediator and Chartered Arbitrator by the ADR Institute of Canada, he is in private practice and serves on the online Condominium Authority Tribunal. Passionate about dispute resolution, Marc supports access to justice, inclusion and overcoming systemic bias. A non-lawyer, Marc has had a 20 year affiliation with a law firm where he gained understanding of the business of legal practice and role of dispute resolution in various processes, on a mandatory and optional basis.

Marc earned a Master of Laws in Dispute Resolution at Osgoode Hall Law School. He now serves as a faculty member of the program, where he lectures, and instructs ALDR 6305: In Search of Reconciliation Through Dispute Resolution. Marc is an Academic Partner of the Authentic Allyship Project, where he supports reconciliation as a non-Indigenous ally, and is a faculty at the Canadian Collaborative for Engagement & Conflict Management. Marc has also lectured at Queen’s University, the University of Calgary Faculty of Law, the University of Saskatchewan College of Law, the Law Society of Ontario and the Canadian Bar Association. He has spoken coast-to-coast and in the United States.

Marc has been widely published. He has written books and been featured in peer-reviewed academic journals, including groundbreaking work on gender-identity and text-based, online mediation in the McGill Journal of Dispute Resolution. Marc’s research has also focused on decision maker bias, self-representation and online processes. The founder of ADR Athletics, a web hub focused on supporting the mental health and wellness of dispute resolution practitioners, Marc has chaired related programs for the ADR Institute of Ontario. He was recognized with a 2020 STAR Award by the institution for his leadership, dedication and impact in the field. In 2022, Marc was elected to represent Ontario on the Board of Directors of the ADR Institute of Canada.

Mary-Anne Popescu

Mary-Anne Popescu

B.A.Sc, ACC.FM, ACC.IM, CP.MED

Mary-Anne has served as the Executive Director of the Ontario Association for Family Mediation (OAFM) since 2015. As an OAFM Accredited Family Mediator, Intergenerational Mediator, and Child Protection Mediator in private practice, she works to bring peaceful resolutions that have helped hundreds of families adapt to challenges and changes across the life cycle. Mary-Anne is a roster mediator for the Office of the Independent Police Review Director (OIPRD) and the Ministry of Government and Consumer Services. She also serves as an Assistant Trainer in the Intergenerational Mediation program at OAFM. In 2020, in response to the global pandemic, Mary-Anne became a Certified Online Mediator.

Mary-Anne is passionate about promoting public access to justice, and has been a facilitator for the Home Court Advantage Summit, as well as the Legal Innovation Zone’s technology initiative to expand equitable access to alternative and non-adversarial services for families. Mary-Anne is a regular guest on the Mediation Station radio program and presenter at various institutions, including Elder Abuse Prevention Ontario, Canadian Domestic Homicide Prevention Initiative, Osgoode Hall Law School, and the International Federation on Ageing. She is also a contributing author to three books, Living Together, Separating, Divorcing: Surviving During a Pandemic, Family Conflict During a Pandemic: Stories of Struggle and Hope, and Grief and Fatigue: Families and the Pandemic.

In 2014, Mary-Anne received the Ontario Medal for Good Citizenship in recognition of her volunteer contributions to St. Joseph’s Maternal Health Support Program. Mary-Anne supports diversity and equality as an ally always, and as a volunteer for Toronto PFLAG. She served as a Panel Member on the City of Toronto Committee of Adjustment, is the past Chair of the ADR Institute of Ontario’s Family Section and past Board Member of the OAFM from 2009 – 2014.

Michelle Hayes

Michelle Hayes

B.S.W., M.S.W., R.S.W., AccFM, D.CPsych(s)

Michelle holds a Bachelor of Social Work degree from the University of Windsor and a Master of Social Work degree from McMaster University. She is a registered social worker and an Accredited Family Mediator serving Hamilton, Halton and Niagara regions. She offers specialized services related to families impacted by separation and divorce including custody and access assessments, family mediation, reintegration therapy, voice of the child reports, parenting coordination, and therapeutic services for children and families impacted by divorce. She is a panelled member of the Office of the Children’s Lawyer and a consultant on high conflict custody disputes to both Hamilton Children’s Aid Societies.

Michelle is a frequent presenter at national and international professional conferences in the area of high conflict separation/divorce and children’s mental health. She is a member of the Ontario College of Social Workers, Ontario Association of Social Workers, Association of Family and Conciliation Courts, and the Ontario Association of Family Mediators. She currently sits on the Board of Directors for the Association of Family and Conciliation Courts, Ontario Chapter, and she is the Past Chair of the Hamilton High Conflict Forum.

Neeraj Goel

Neeraj Goel

B.A., LL.B., ACC.FM

In practice since 2000, Neeraj practices in Toronto as a family lawyer and family mediator, helping couples who are cohabiting or separating to come to their own durable legal agreements through collaborative negotiation. Neeraj has mediated a wide variety of cases from the very simple to the very complex in all aspects of family law including property division, spousal/child support, parenting plans, prenuptial agreements and cohabitation agreements.

In his first five years of practice, Neeraj practiced law with Legal Aid Ontario, West Scarborough Community Legal Services, and the Ontario Ministry of the Attorney General. In 2005, he made the decision to become a sole practitioner focusing exclusively on collaborative family law and family mediation. In addition to maintaining a busy practice, he has sat on the Board of Collaborative Practice Toronto and has served as a Roster Mediator with Mediate393, which provides government-funded family mediation services. Neeraj has spoken on family dispute resolution in various mediation and professional development programs in Ontario, including Collaborative Practice Toronto, the Ontario Association for Family Mediation and now, with York University’s School of Continuing Education.

A graduate of Osgoode Hall Law School, Neeraj has volunteered as a coach with Riverdale Mediation and the Law Society of Ontario. He currently Co-Chair of the Mentor Program for the Family Dispute Resolution Institute of Ontario.

Oliver Martin

Oliver Martin

B.Comm, MA

Oliver Martin (he/him) is a highly skilled and experienced mediator, instructor, coach, and workplace consultant. He is dedicated to helping individuals, teams, organizations, and communities connect to self, others, and systems to transform workplace relationships. Since 2003, he has partnered with numerous individuals and organizations throughout Canada, the United States and the Caribbean to improve their ability to lead themself and others through challenging situations. He has also worked behind the scenes in high-profile workplace disputes.

In private practice, Oliver provides training and consultation in conflict resolution, mediation, negotiation, communication, emotional intelligence and leadership development. He also provides mediation, coaching and workplace restorations in unionized and non-unionized environments. He applies an emotional intelligence and organizational systems lens to workplace conflict with a trauma-informed approach.

Oliver is a Senior Consultant at the University of Guelph, providing faculty and staff leadership training, coaching, facilitation, and conflict resolution services. Previously, he was the Director of Training for the Stitt Feld Handy Group (a division of ADR Chambers), an Instructor for the Master’s Certificate in Healthcare Management at Schulich’s Executive Education Centre (York University), and a past Director at the ADR Institute of Ontario.

Oliver received Alternative Dispute Resolution training from the University of Windsor Law School and York University. He has a Master of Arts in Leadership from Royal Roads University. In addition to his training and experience as a mediator, Oliver is certified to administer the Myers-Briggs Type Indicator and the Emotional Intelligence (WE-Q) Profile.

Oliver combines his conflict resolution, emotional intelligence and leadership development expertise to teach others and to create brave spaces for people to connect and transform challenging workplace relationships.

Pramila Javaheri

Pramila Javaheri

BA (Hons), C.Med

Pramila is the Executive Director at ADR Institute of Ontario, an engaging speaker, and Chartered Mediator with over 22 years of experience. Her mediation experience encompasses workplace, residential and commercial properties, personal injury, employment and business-related contractual disputes, statutory accident benefits, community and criminal disputes.

Pramila has held leadership roles as President of the Community Legal Clinic of York Region, Chair of the Social Planning Council of York Region, and Vice-President of the ADR Institute of Ontario. Her work has been featured on CBC radio, televised on CTV, and published in the Toronto Star. She has taught at Schulich School of Business, Toronto Metropolitan University, Centennial College, George Brown College and Seneca College. Pramila has provided coaching, mediation, ADR & leadership training, and consulting services to thousands of participants representing union groups, crown corporations, major Canadian enterprises, faith groups and community organizations across Canada.

In addition to her mediation practice, Pramila has extensive background in Community Development (CD) and uses engagement strategies, research, and her skills in ADR in CD to mobilize and empower community groups and organizations to create and sustain long-lasting positive changes in neighbourhoods across the GTA. In this capacity, Pramila has instructed and mentored students at the Creative Institute for Toronto’s Young Leaders (CITY Leaders) and the Toronto’s Centre for Community Learning and Development. She has led the implementation of hundreds of programs and services and has received numerous leadership and mentorship awards from elected officials at all levels of government for her work in strengthening the community.

Vicky Ringuette

Vicky Ringuette

ACC.FM, BA, LL.B., FDRP-Med

Vicky has been practicing law since 2005 and works primarily in Family Law in the areas of separation and divorce, child protection, adoption, ​​fertility and surrogacy. She is an accredited family mediator and trained cross-border mediator in international child abductions. She is also a facilitator of Legal Aid Settlement Conferences and sits as a Dispute Resolution Officer at the Superior Court of Justice, Family Court Branch in various jurisdictions across Ontario. She is a Panel Lawyer with the Office of the Children’s Lawyer and serves as per diem Duty Counsel at the Family Court. She is also a member of the Association of Family and Conciliation Courts – Ontario Chapter (AFCC-O) Parenting Plan Guide Project Task Force.

Vicky is a Coach with the Law Society of Ontario’s Coach and Advisor Network. She volunteers her time as a member of the Board of Directors of l’Association des juristes d’expression française de l’Ontario (AJEFO) and the Family Dispute Resolution Institute of Ontario (FDRIO). As a presenter at conferences, seminars, and other professional development events across Canada, she offers her knowledge and passion for Family Law, technology integration in the workplace, as well as the impact of new technologies like cryptocurrency in the financial disclosure process in legal proceedings. Vicky is originally from Northwestern New Brunswick and is fluently bilingual in French and English. She holds a Bachelor of Arts with a concentration in Communication and a Bachelor of Laws (Common Law in French – LL.B.) both from the University of Ottawa.
